cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.AI, cs.FL. 

The paper discusses the use of Horn clauses for program verification and synthesis, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several computer science sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), as Horn clauses are a logical formalism used in automated reasoning and program analysis. The second likely category is cs.PL (Programming Languages), as the paper discusses the use of Horn clauses in program synthesis. The third likely category is cs.SE (Software Engineering), as program verification and synthesis are important topics in software engineering. The fourth likely category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as Horn clauses are used in automated reasoning and knowledge representation, which are important topics in AI. The fifth likely category is cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory), as Horn clauses are a formalism used in automata theory and formal language theory.
